```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```
Let import the 'FAS_litters.csv' csv. using a relative path

```{r}
litters_df=
  read_csv("data_import_examples/FAS_litters.csv")


litters_df=
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

import the same datset using an absolute path.

```{r}
litters_df=
  read_csv("data_import_examples/FAS_litters.csv")


litters_df=
  janitor::clean_names(litters_df)
```

Importing "FAS_pups.csv"

```{r}
pups_df=
  read_csv("data_import_examples/FAS_pups.csv")


pups_df=
  janitor::clean_names(pups_df)
```

## look at data
```{r}
litters_df

head(litters_df)

tail(littles_df)
```

You can use "view"

```{r, eval=FALSE}
view(litters_df)
```

Look at a data summary

```{r}
skimr::skim(litters_data)
```

##Options in "read_*"
skip the first row of data 

```{r}
litters_df=
   read_csv(
     "data_import_examples/FAS_litters.csv",
     skip = 1)
```

Look at NA value

```{r}
litters_df =
  read_csv(
  "data_import_examples/FAS_litters.csv",
  na = c("NA",19))
```
  
Column type 

```{r}
litters_df=
  read_csv("data_import_examples/FAS_litters.csv",
           )
